oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Clint Black Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Clint Black (performer) conducted by Biff Collie. Around nineteen minute mark of tape is a recording of an interview with Kathie Baillie and Michael Bonagura (performers) conducted by Biff Collie. Around forty-six minute mark of tape is a recording of an interview with Suzy Bogguss (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Clint Black; Biff Collie; Kathie Baillie; Michael Bonaguara; Suzy Bogguss
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Clint Black introduces himself and talks about moving to Houston, Texas -- (00:34) Biff Collie and Black talk about the sudden rise to popularity despite Black being a recording artist for twelve years -- (01:10) Black and Collie talk about down time's relation to "Killin' Time" -- (01:30) Black talks about losing inspiration for "Killin' Time" for over a month before discovering the hook -- (02:14) Black talks about "Nothing's News" and his father describing his life as too plain to be a country writer -- (02:58) Black talks about "Winding Down" as a quickly written song when we was working as a soloist -- (03:33) Collie and Black discuss winding down after a show -- (04:09) "Live and Learn" by Black is recalled as a desire to find the right guitar lick -- (04:48) Collie and Black discuss the song that took two years for Black to write -- (05:33) Collie asks black to give his personal information -- (05:47) Black recalls, in his youth, when he determined he was going to be a m
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Black, Clint; Collie, Biff; Baillie and the Boys; Baillie, Kathie; Bonagura, Michael; Bogguss, Suzy;
